DOC.brief_title: Free Fatty Acid Induced Insulin Resistance
DOC.detailed_description: Increased availability free fatty acid impairs glucose disposal young healthy human . Patients type 2 diabetes reduce whole body glucose disposal , increase ectopic lipid deposition skeletal muscle liver impair mitochondrial function . Recent study suggest lipid metabolite diacylglycerol ( DAG ) , ceramides long-chain acyl-coA represent active mediator induce insulin resistance . Possible target DAG-sensitive Proteinkinase C ( PKC θ , PKC ε ) inhibit insulin signal cascade ceramides interfere insulin signal cascade Proteinkinase B/AKT . Prior study raise controvesial evidence , thus , yet unclear , whether DAG ceramides primary agent inducig lipid-induced insulin resistance . Therefore , current study aim explore time course appearance intramyocellular lipid compunds lipid infusion parallel assess marker impaired insulin action .
DOC.criteria: nondiabetic ( OGTT ) , family history diabetes , BMI < 30 kg/m2 , age : 2055 year , medication , acute illness within last 2 week , autoimmune disease , renal insufficiency ( creatinine > 1.5 mg/dl ) , cardiovascular disease , anemia ( Hb < 12g/l ) , donation blood within last 4 week study , thyroid disease , pregnancy , smoking , nightshift work ( disturbed circadian rhythm ) , defective coagulation wound healing , cancer , allergy soja product
